node.title: Germany has swept the sliding sports so far: six events, six golds.
node.alt: Christopher Grotheer, right, and Axel Jungk won gold and silver in men’s skeleton.
node.description: The country’s winning streak may end on Monday, however, with the women’s monobob race.
node.content: ["On their backs or on their bellies, by themselves or in pairs, competing in a relay \u2014 it has not mattered for Germany.", "German athletes are repeatedly sailing down the National Sliding Center\u2019s track and coming back up with medals. Through Saturday, their record was perfect: six events, six golds.", "With devoted resources and four domestic tracks, Germany has long been a powerhouse in sliding sports. But it is extending its dominance another level at the Beijing Games.", "Germans first swept the golds in the four luge disciplines, winning the men\u2019s and women\u2019s singles and the men\u2019s doubles, and then putting those champions together for the team event. Few were surprised when that squad, too, collected a gold.", "Next came skeleton, the event where athletes hurl themselves headfirst down the track. Christopher Grotheer won gold in the men\u2019s event before Hannah Neise\u2019s surprising first in the women\u2019s competition interrupted a procession of three straight British champions in the event. Until this year, skeleton had been the only sliding sport in which Germany had never won the gold. Now, it has two in a weekend.", "\u201cIt means a lot, especially for skeleton sliders,\u201d Neise said of her victory. \u201cWe haven\u2019t had so many medals the past years, and we are very proud to represent our country and our federation. It\u2019s a step forward for us.\u201d", "In many of the early sliding competitions, Germany\u2019s dominance was so complete that it featured teammates competing with one another for podium positioning. The country also collected silver medals in women\u2019s singles and men\u2019s doubles luge and in men\u2019s skeleton.", "\u201cEvery race we want to beat each other,\u201d said Axel Jungk, who finished second to Grotheer. \u201cI think this is the reason why we are so good this year: We push each other to the limits.\u201d", "Germany\u2019s shot at a clean sweep of the sliding events may end soon, however. Laura Nolte ranks third after the first two heats in monobob, and trails the overnight leader, Kaillie Humphries of the United States, by 1.22 seconds heading into the final two runs on Monday.", "\u201cBut you can see you can easily lose a second in the run, like I did,\u201d Nolte said. \u201cSo yeah, we won\u2019t give up yet.\u201d", "Any time spent away from gold may be short lived for Germany, however: The pilot Francesco Friedrich will be a favorite in the two-man and four-man bobsled events."]
